summary: Frank Thompson, Jr. is mentioned in four documents related to the Assassination Records Review Board's (ARRB) review of HSCA staff payroll records. The documents primarily concern the postponement of the release of Social Security numbers from these records to protect personal privacy. While Frank Thompson, Jr.'s specific role or connection to the JFK assassination is not explicitly detailed in the provided summaries, his name appears within the context of these payroll records, suggesting he was likely a staff member or otherwise associated with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents include Final Determination Notifications from the ARRB and related payroll authorization forms.
significance: The significance of Frank Thompson, Jr. lies in his association with the HSCA, the committee responsible for reinvestigating the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify his role, his presence in the HSCA staff payroll records indicates some level of involvement in the investigation. The ARRB's review of these records and the postponement of releasing Social Security numbers highlight the complexities of balancing transparency with personal privacy in the context of assassination-related documents.
